pullrequest.title: Launch file and 5 example worlds for finals

content.raw:
You can pass `gui:=true` when roslaunching:

    roslaunch srcsim finals.launch final_number:=5 gui:=true

Or you can always open a `gzclient` while the simulation is running.
content.html:
You can pass gui:=true when roslaunching:

roslaunch srcsim finals.launch final_number:=5 gui:=true

Or you can always open a gzclient while the simulation is running.

pull_request.title: Launch file and 5 example worlds for finals

pullrequest.title: Launch file and 5 example worlds for finals

content.raw: Can the gui be enabled via the command line?
content.html: Can the gui be enabled via the command line?

pull_request.title: Launch file and 5 example worlds for finals

update.description:
This builds on top of ~~pull request #57~~

* Add `finals.launch`, which is the file launched by CloudSim during practice and finals
* `finals.launch` differs from `unique.launch`:
    * `init` is true by default
    * `gui` is false by default sop gzclient is not launched
    * it accepts a `final_number` argument with numbers from 1 to 5 to choose which world to launch
* Generated 5 sample worlds for practice. The real ones will not be made public before the finals.

Usage:

`roslaunch srcsim finals.launch final_number:=2`
update.title: Launch file and 5 example worlds for finals

content.raw: Oh, you said that in the opening, and I totally glossed over it.  Sorry about that!  Thanks for the explanation.

pull_request.title: Launch file and 5 example worlds for finals

pullrequest.title: Launch file and 5 example worlds for finals

content.raw:
Yes, these worlds are mainly meant to be run headless, the way the final competition will be (on AWS by cloudsim), so it's convenient to leave it false by default. You can turn GUI on locally by setting it to true, for example:

`roslaunch srcsim finals.launch final_number:=5 gui:=true`
content.html:
Yes, these worlds are mainly meant to be run headless, the way the final competition will be (on AWS by cloudsim), so it's convenient to leave it false by default. You can turn GUI on locally by setting it to true, for example:

roslaunch srcsim finals.launch final_number:=5 gui:=true

pull_request.title: Launch file and 5 example worlds for finals

pullrequest.title: Launch file and 5 example worlds for finals

content.raw: Having gui=false by default threw me off a bit here.  Is having the GUI off by default intentional?
content.html: Having gui=false by default threw me off a bit here. Is having the GUI off by default intentional?

pullrequest.title: Launch file and 5 example worlds for finals

content.raw:
I think it's a problem resolving the full path from `~`. This works for me:

`roslaunch srcsim unique.launch extra_gazebo_args:="-r --record_path /tmp/mylogs/"`
content.html:
I think it's a problem resolving the full path from ~. This works for me:

roslaunch srcsim unique.launch extra_gazebo_args:="-r --record_path /tmp/mylogs/"

pull_request.title: Launch file and 5 example worlds for finals

pullrequest.title: Launch file and 5 example worlds for finals

content.raw: I'm seeing the same problem, debugging a bit now. If you're blocked by this, maybe you can try just with `-r`, and the logs will end up in `~/.gazebo/log`
content.html: I'm seeing the same problem, debugging a bit now. If you're blocked by this, maybe you can try just with -r, and the logs will end up in ~/.gazebo/log

pull_request.title: Launch file and 5 example worlds for finals

pullrequest.title: Launch file and 5 example worlds for finals

content.raw:
Hi Louise,
I've tried with a slightly modified version of the command (ie. using unique.launch):  

```
roslaunch srcsim unique.launch extra_gazebo_args:="-r --record_path ~/mylogs/"

```
but it didn't seem to generate the gazebo logs in that path :(.  I also tried in my local dev machine , but no luck either. 

Do you know if there are any other arguments that I should send to this roslaunch script ? 

Thanks!
content.html:
Hi Louise, I've tried with a slightly modified version of the command (ie. using unique.launch): 

roslaunch srcsim unique.launch extra_gazebo_args:="-r --record_path ~/mylogs/"

but it didn't seem to generate the gazebo logs in that path :(. I also tried in my local dev machine , but no luck either.

Do you know if there are any other arguments that I should send to this roslaunch script ?

Thanks!

pullrequest.title: Launch file and 5 example worlds for finals

content.raw:
It should be possible to do it like this:

`roslaunch srcsim finals.launch final_number:=2 extra_gazebo_args:="-r --record_path ~/gazebo-logs/myworldlog"`
content.html:
It should be possible to do it like this:

roslaunch srcsim finals.launch final_number:=2 extra_gazebo_args:="-r --record_path ~/gazebo-logs/myworldlog"

pull_request.title: Launch file and 5 example worlds for finals

pullrequest.title: Launch file and 5 example worlds for finals

content.raw:
Hi @chapulina , just a quick question: how can we configure the gazebo log file in these scripts ?  

Similar to what we have with gazebo :  $ gzserver -r --record_path ~/gazebo-logs/myworldlog

thanks in advance!
content.html:
Hi @chapulina , just a quick question: how can we configure the gazebo log file in these scripts ?

Similar to what we have with gazebo : $ gzserver -r --record_path ~/gazebo-logs/myworldlog

thanks in advance!
